channel.title: Clagnut summaries
channel.description: A blog by Richard Rutter. Root through a heap of web design and development stuff and a few other tasty morsels. (latest 10 posts in summary)

item.title: Retrofitting fluid typography
item.description: As part of my forthcoming Patterns Day talk I decided to rebuild the newly redesigned Creative Boom article page using Utopian fluid typography to replace its multitude of breakpoints. This is the story of why and how. Read more.

item.title: Pagination widows, or, Why Iâ€™m embarrassed about my ebook
item.description: The handling of widowed headings across pages in Apple Books is of particular concern. Since 1997, CSS has had properties to handle this, and yet browsers including Safari and Firefox still don't support them – why not? Read more.

item.title: Preventing too-short final lines of text blocks
item.description: At the end my previous post, I said Iâ€™d settle for direct control over widows and orphans in text blocks. It turns out not to be quite as a simple as one might think, with lots of discussion over the years. I created an experiment to test a solution. Read more.

item.title: An end to typographic widows on the web
item.description: Currently shipping in Chrome Canary, and thus soon to be in Blink-based browsers including Edge, is a relatively new CSS declaration which promises to virtually end typographic widows. Read more.

item.title: Font optical sizing bug in Safari 16
item.description: In my previous post I extolled the virtues of Literataâ€™s font optical sizing, in particular how it worked automatically in the browser. That is until the release of Safari 16 with macOS Ventura. Here's how to work around the bug. Read more.

item.title: New year, new typeface: switching to variable fonts
item.description: My website used to be set primarily in two very different typefaces: Ingeborg and PremiÃ©ra. This is story of how I switched to a fantastic single variable font which provided the same practical and stylistic benefits, only better. Read more.

item.title: My experience of using ChatGPT AI
item.description: I had fun playing around with ChatGPT, but the implications of such a powerful tool are serious, good and bad. Read more.

item.title: Avoiding groupthink: fine-tuning CSS specifications
item.description: Every now and then Iâ€™m asked to help out the CSS Working Group, especially when typography is involved. Invariably itâ€™s also a chance to learn, not just about upcoming CSS, but also new methods of collaboration and group decision making. Read more.

item.title: How to typeset a date range properly
item.description: During these 10 days of mourning following the death of the Queen, wherever you look – on websites, billboards and shop windows – we are presented with a badly typeset date range: 1926 – 2022. Here's how to do it correctly. Read more.

item.title: How to subset a variable font
item.description: Professional fonts can contain a lot characters you will never use, increasing file size uncessarily. These characters can be removed by subsetting a font. This post explains how to subset fonts from first principles on a Mac using fonttools. Read more.
